# 962-DOLINE
#### A hard mid-late game moon, with some hints of Artifice and Adamance.
### `POPULATION: None` <br>

### `CONDITIONS: Dark, heavy atmosphere. Flooded valleys. Century old underground systems scattered across it's surface.`<br>

### `HISTORY: Before being officially designated and converted into a wildlife sanctuary, Doline was mined for it's resources, mainly Iron and Bauxite. On 2154, Doline became part of a group of celestial bodies nicknamed "Bunker Planets" on the height of The Great War, the total number of bunkers in it's surface is unknown, but it's estimated to be ~3.000.000. Nowadays, access is available only to select personnel for maintenance and extraction of scrap.`<br>

### `FAUNA: Nearly untouched. Diverse and Aggressive.`<br>

<h2>Recommended Mods</h2>

- ![Biodiversity](https://thunderstore.io/c/lethal-company/p/super_fucking_cool_and_badass_team/Biodiversity): This moon supports Ogopogo, an unique hostile entity that spawns in the water!
- ![Generic Interiors](https://thunderstore.io/c/lethal-company/p/Generic_GMD/Generic_Interiors): As per Doline's theming, i find that Generic's Drains interior to be really fitting! Download this mod for an even better experience.

<h2>Background</h2>

This moon is the result of me trying over and over again to make a moon, only for me to run out of creativity and motivation and discard it right after...
It took 3 different moons to get it right, one after another i would completely get overwhelmed by the number of features i wanted to add, without even finishing the map itself, thus i ended up scrapping all of them. But right after my third attempt, i just thought to myself "Just make it exist", then work on Doline began, and thus after 3 complete reworks, Doline was born...

Anyways, about my philosophy of the map's gameplay, i felt like there was a big gap between the free moons and Rend, thus i planned out a way to make a cheaper version of Rend, harder but with better chances for profit.

Although there's more i wished i could add, Doline will more so serve as an anchor for my mooning shenanigans, and now with my vision already set, mooning will become easier for me as time goes (maybe i could start fiddling with some cool features the other libs got...) 

More to come ðŸ‘€
</details>
